articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Families of KPA Servicemen
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance Given by Art Groups of Families of KPA Servicemen
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed a performance given by the members of the art groups of families of servicemen of Unit 529 and the Navy Command of the KPA who participated in the second round of the second-term contest among art groups of families of KPA servicemen.
					 They put on the stage poem reciting "Oh, Fireworks Heralding the Emergence of a Thriving Nation," quartet "Cuckoo on the Road to the Front", drum beating and song "Let's Dash towards Thriving Nation Like the Wind" and other colorful numbers of diverse genres.
					
					 Through the performance they enthusiastically sang of their honor of living and struggling full of great pride and self-confidence of being cooks of the supreme command and fully demonstrated unshakable faith and will of the families of the servicemen of the KPA to devotedly defend the headquarters of the revolution and surely win a final victory of the Korean revolution, standing in the same trench with their husbands all out in the struggle to defend the country at the cost of their lives.
					
					 Kim Jong Il highly appreciated their successful performance, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the members of the above-said art groups staged a splendid performance clear in the political import of its theme as they give solutions to the socio-political issues in the Songun era.
					
					 All the numbers put on the stage are of great cognitional and instructive significance as they make a profound ideological and artistic clarification of important issues arising in the struggle and life of the people in the Songun era by depicting the essential and significant aspects of the life, firmly based on the reality, he noted, highly praising them for having successfully created and staged peculiar works.
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats performed by the families of servicemen of the KPA, noting that they are beloved and trustworthy women revolutionaries who sincerely help their husbands in their revolutionary work, dedicating themselves to the prosperity of the country, not working for their families' happiness only.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA General Kim Jong Gak, first vice director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae, Ri Myong Su and Kim Won Hong and Col. General Han Tong Gun and other commanding officers of the KPA, Secretary of the WPK Central Committee Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors of the WPK Central Committee Jang Song Thaek, Choe Ik Gyu and Kim Yang Gon and other senior officials of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Greetings to Italian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Italian President
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Giorgio Napolitano, President of the Republic of Italy, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Kim in the message expressed the belief that the good relations between the DPRK and Italy would grow stronger on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries to be greeted before long, wishing the President and the Italian people successes in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Organization
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Shanghai Association for Cultural Exchanges with Foreign Countries of China.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Gao Ling, assistant to the secretary general of the association, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Exhibition of Korean and Chinese Children Opened
articles.content:
Exhibition of Korean and Chinese Children Opened
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of calligraphic works and drawings produced by Korean and Chinese children was opened on the occasion of the International Children's Day this year, a "year of DPRK-China friendship."
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace on Monday.
					
					 Attending it were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and schoolchildren in the city of Pyongyang and a delegation of the Shanghai Association for Cultural Exchanges with Foreign Countries of China led by Gao Ling, assistant to the secretary general of the association, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The speakers said that carried in the exhibits are the Korean and Chinese children's beautiful dreams about future and their resolution to develop the DPRK-China friendship generation after generation. 
					
					 They expressed belief that the exhibition would be conducive to deepening the friendship between the children, youths and other people of the two countries and significantly adorning the "year of DPRK-China friendship."

articles.title: International Children's Day Marked
articles.content:
International Children's Day Marked
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- A joint friendly meeting took place at the Taesongsan Pleasure Park on June 1 on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of the International Children's Day.
					 Present there were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, former unconverted long-term prisoners, officials concerned, children and women here.  
					
					  Present there on invitation were women of diplomatic missions of different countries here and other foreign women and children and foreign guests and overseas compatriots staying in the homeland. 
					
					 Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, made a congratulatory speech. 
					
					 Then followed a competition between the team "Kosumdochi" (hedgehog) and "Noguri" (raccoon dog), each made up of Korean and foreign children. They had diverse sports and amusement games such as archery, snatching a ball, jumping over flower-decorated rope, picking toys and tug-of-war. 
					
					 There was an art performance given by Korean and foreign children.

articles.title: International Children's Day Enjoyed
articles.content:
International Children's Day Enjoyed
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Children in the DPRK happily spent June 1, the International Children's Day.
					  Sports and amusement games and performances were held at the Kim Jong Suk Nursery, the Kang Pan Sok Nursery, the Changgwang Kindergarten and other nurseries and kindergartens in the capital city of Pyongyang.
					
					 Among the sports and amusement games were toy-picking, stone bridge-crossing, running with a ball in arms and leapfrogging.
					
					  Nurseries and kindergartens at industrial establishments and on co-op farms across the country were also seethed with children enjoying their holiday.
					
					There were sports and amusement game involving more than 10,000 children in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, and an art performance of kindergarteners in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Happy and merry voices of singing children could be also heard at nurseries and kindergartens in Wonsan of Kangwon Province, Sariwon of North Hwanghae Province, Sinuiju of North Phyongan Province and Manpho of Jagang Province.

articles.title: More Meetings Hail Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
More Meetings Hail Successful Nuclear Test
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in North Phyongan, South Hamgyong, North Hamgyong and Ryanggang provinces of the DPRK to hail the second successful nuclear test.
					 Present there were leading officials of local party and power organs and working people's organizations, servicepersons, working people of different circles and youth and students.
					
					 Speakers at the meetings said that the recent nuclear test helped further strengthen the power and defence capability of Songun Korea as it satisfactorily solved the scientific and technological problems for developing the nuclear technology of the DPRK.
					
					 They said that the army and people of the DPRK, who demonstrated to the world the spirit of Juche Korea making no concessions in defending the supreme interests and sovereignty of the country, would dynamically advance along the road of independence, the road of Songun, full of confidence in sure victory and optimism.
					
					 They stressed that the Korean revolution is sure to triumph as it is led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: New Stone Buddha Grotto Discovered in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stone Buddha Grotto Discovered in DPRK
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The first sokgul temple (stone Buddha grotto) showing extraordinary artistic talent of the Korean ancestors has of late been discovered in the DPRK.
					Sokgul temple is a small natural or artificial stone-cave temple. The sokgul temple was erected for the purpose of mystifying and permanently preserving Buddhist idols and other graven images and of holding religious rites even in bad weather.
					
					The Thonggyongsan Sokgul Temple is located about three kilometers northeast of Chojang-ri in Kwaksan County, North Phyongan Province. Its terrain looks like a tiger in a crouch.
					
					A 9-meter-high and about 7-meter-wide stone stands in incline on the left hand of the entrance to the nearly 3.3-meter-high sokgul temple and two big stones stand on its right hand.
					
					Seven Buddhist images are carved in relief inside the temple.
					
					In particular dignified three Amitabha images and their hand-manners are described delicately like living ones.
					
					So vivid and exquisite is the sculpture of a lotus-flower-shaped stand, which gives a feeling of viewing lotus flowers in full bloom on the surface of the water, and others.
					
					The Thonggyongsan Sokgul Temple, built in a natural cave in the period from the end of Koryo to the beginning of Ri Dynasty, shows well the then architecture, sculpture, religion and the like.
					
					Only the Kyongju and Kunwi Sokgul Temples and other sokgul temples have been widely known in Korea.
					
					The newly-discovered sokgul temple proves once again the time-honored cultural commonness of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Infant Prodigies of Music
articles.content:
Infant Prodigies of Music
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- There are many musical infant prodigies in the DPRK.
					 Among them are Yu Pyol Mi and Yun Il studying at the primary class of Pyongyang School of Music and Dance.
					
					 The piano technique of Yu Pyol Mi, eight, strikes people with admiration.
					
					 Gifted with musical talent, she was called piano prodigy from her kindergarten years and was screened by TV at the age of six.
					
					 She, who is quick in playing music without practice and correct in sound detection, has prominent playing technique and creative ability.  She has composed more than 20 works including "The Sun and Little Flower" and "Rays of Love".
					
					 Born into an ordinary worker's family, Yun Il is also famous as violin child prodigy.
					
					 Having received elementary music education at Pyongyang Taedongmun Kindergarten, he has reached the expert level in a long memory, sensitive faculties and delicate emotional expression.
					
					 People admire at the unique playing technique and rich musical depiction of the ten-year-old child when he performs songs including "We Will Be Loyal Down through Generations" and "Children's Union March".
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, with loftiest outlook on the rising generation, saw for himself the performances of the infant prodigies, highly spoke of them and blessed their future.
					
					 The Juche-oriented art will be further flourished by the musical child prodigies who are polishing their musical talent to the heart's content under the care of the DPRK.

articles.title: Love People
articles.content:
Love People
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- Ten odd workers of a timber mill joined the unit of the guerrilla army led in person by President Kim Il Sung in October Juche 25 (1936).
					 The President took along with him three youngest members among the recruits from the first day they joined the unit.
					
					 One day they picked bagfuls of maize with the shuck unremoved on the way back from the sentry post without the permission of its owner.
					
					 They wanted to serve the President with plentiful maize, thinking they could not allow him to go with plain water, however scanty the food was at the unit.
					
					 Telling them they had gravely encroached on the interests of people that day, he made them take back all the maize to the side of the field of the peasant.
					
					 He told them to love the people more ardently, drawing a lesson from what they had done that day. He said the people would give them a wide berth, if they slighted them and there was no more terrible thing than being forsaken by the people.
					
					 He said the greatest tragedy for a revolutionary was to lose the love of the people. "Upon whom could we depend in our fight, if we lost the love and support of the people?" he asked.

articles.title: KCNA Slams U.S. Administration's Invariable Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Slams U.S. Administration's Invariable Hostile Policy towards DPRK
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- U.S. President Obama was reported to have markedly increased the spending for overseas broadcasting in the budget for the fiscal 2010 submitted to Congress the bulk of which is to go to those broadcasting services that specialize in the anti-DPRK propaganda. 
					 This indicates that the present U.S. administration remains unchanged in its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 "The Voice of Free Asia" operated by the U.S. started its Korean language programs in March 1997. The U.S. has since increased the time for broadcasting by steadily boosting its financial disbursement for the reptile broadcasting services.
					
					 It allotted 2 million U.S. dollars for its anti-DPRK operation in the fiscal 1998. A huge financial allocation was made for this purpose until 2008 according to the "North Korean Human Rights Act."
					
					 The Obama administration's huge spending for smear broadcasting against the DPRK indicates that it is little different from the preceding regimes in the hostile policy towards it. 
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. rulers asserted that the important role of the broadcasting services for overseas listeners to meet U.S. interests is reflected in the new budget. 
					
					 It is, indeed, a base and mean act to deceive the world.
					
					 The main objective of "the Voice of Free Asia" and the Voice of America is to disseminate the American-style "freedom" and "democracy" and corrupt bourgeois way of living to the DPRK and other Asian countries.
					
					 Most of the contents of their broadcasting programs are a whole string of vituperation against the top leaders of those countries, stories finding fault with their policies, interference in their internal affairs and reactionary propaganda.
					
					 It is needless to say that the activities of the above-mentioned broadcasting services are designed to bring down the DPRK and other countries which do not meekly follow the instructions of the U.S. or incur its displeasure. 
					
					 The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it calculates the above-said media's spread of "freedom" and "democracy" would help eliminate the ideology and system chosen by the people of the DPRK themselves.
					
					 They cherished the ideology in the DPRK as their faith in the course of a protracted and arduous struggle and regard the most advantageous Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses as more important than their own lives.
					
					 The U.S. is keen to bring down the dignified and inviolable system in the DPRK and looks forward to any "change" there. This is nothing but a day-dream of those who know nothing of the single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the masses. 
					
					 Intolerable is the U.S. attempt to do harm to the DPRK by increasing the funds for the reptile broadcasting services and enlarging their broadcasting hours. 
					
					 The new U.S. administration has run the whole gamut of accusations against the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful ends and put the sanctions against the DPRK into force.
					
					 And it succeeded in plugging the south Korean puppets into the PSI.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK will remain unchanged no matter who takes presidential office in the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK will bolster up its nuclear deterrent to protect its ideology and system as already clarified.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Action against Progressive Forces Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Fascist Action against Progressive Forces Flayed
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean fascist authorities, at a recent meeting of "ministers and chiefs of agencies held to bring illegal and violent demonstrations under control," officially declared that they would "disallow" large rallies to be staged by people from all walks of life, arrest on the spot participants in demonstrations and take legal actions against all of them. 
					 Acting upon this instruction, they threatened that meetings with large attendance would be held in check in advance in south Korea, and their participants would be arrested on the spot and, if not, they would be chased till they are rounded up and punished. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The fascist action taken by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is a product of its criminal scenario to "totally block" the massive advance of people from all walks of life for justice and progress, democratic freedom and rights and mercilessly suppress their actions by violence.
					
					 With no crackdown at the point of bayonet can the fascist gang stamp out justice and truth, the commentary notes, and continues:
					
					 The south Korean people's struggle for democratic freedom and rights is just and their patriotic cause of independence, democracy and national reunification is unanimously supported and approved by the Koreans and all other progressives of the world.  
					
					 The south Korean people will never cease their struggle for justice and progress for fear of the above-said fascist suppression. They will carry on their struggle for independence, democracy and national reunification, braving death. 
					
					 This fascist action taken against the south Korean people from all walks of life would only touch off their bitterer resentment at the Lee gang and harden their will to intensify their struggle. 
					
					 They will struggle to the last, not yielding to the fascist suppression, and bring the fascist regime veiled with the signboard of "pragmatism" to its downfall without fail.  The group of traitors is fated to meet their miserable end due to the people's fierce resistance.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Inter-Korean Declarations
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Inter-Korean Declarations
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration are the great programmes for reunification common to the nation as the north and the south agreed upon and solemnly declared at home and abroad reflecting all Koreans' will for the independent development of the nation and the peace and reunification of the country
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a signed article.
					
					The said declarations are, to all intents and purposes, declarations on national independence to realize all Koreans' desire and wishes for independence, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					All Koreans should hold aloft the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration in order to independently solve the issues of the inter-Korean relations and reunification free from outside forces' interference according to the will to achieve independence.
					
					These declarations are patriotic ones aimed to develop the inter-Korean relations, reunify the country and achieve the co-prosperity of the nation.
					
					They clearly indicate the practical ways for the north and the south to achieve reconciliation and unity, advance towards the reunification and bring about the prosperity common to the nation through mutual cooperation as they have stood in confrontation for decades since the division.
					
					They are declarations on protecting peace as they pave a wide avenue for easing tension on the Korean Peninsula and achieving the country's durable peace.
					
					These inter-Korean declarations specify tasks and ways to remove the danger of a war and ensure lasting peace on the peninsula. They reflect all Koreans' wishes for the peace of the country and its peaceful reunification.
					
					The U.S. and its lackey the Lee Myung Bak regime are still persistent in their moves against reunification because they are escalating the confrontation and tension on the peninsula, opposed to the historic inter-Korean declarations and standing in the way of implementing them. 
					
					With no machination, however, can the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad stamp out the validity and vitality of the said-declarations or quell the will to support and uphold these declarations rooted deep in the minds of all Koreans at home and abroad.

articles.title: Slogans for Urgent Struggle Issued in S. Korea
articles.content:
Slogans for Urgent Struggle Issued in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea on May 29 made public slogans for urgent struggle calling on the people from all walks of life to turn out in the action to force the Lee Myung Bak "government," a group of fascist dictators and murderers, to step down.
					 Contending that the south Korean people can not live under the same sky with the Lee "government," the slogans demanded resignation of the "government," immediate dissolution of the "prosecution," a servant to dictator Myung Bak, and so forth.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test Hailed by British Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test Hailed by British Organizations
Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on May 26 in support of the second successful nuclear test conducted by the DPRK.
					 The statement said that the recent successful nuclear test is the shining fruition of the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il and a great victory of the DPRK.
					
					 To respect the opinion of the international community does not mean that a sovereign state should sacrifice its supreme interests, it said, and went on: The DPRK conducted the nuclear test to bolster up its defence capability in every way and more firmly defend the socialist system centered on the popular masses and the sovereignty of the country, making a great contribution to the reunification of the Korean Peninsula and the global peace and security.
					
					 Bitterly denouncing the U.S. imperialists and their followers for all their moves critical of the DPRK's nuclear test, the statement called on the world progressives to fully support the just cause of the Korean people standing against the U.S. imperialists' threat, pressure and intervention aimed at stifling the socialist system.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion inaugural del Teatro Kalma
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion inaugural del Teatro Kalma
						
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente  Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito dedicada a la inauguracion del Teatro Kalma.
					   Ante todo, el Dirigente recorrio el teatro nuevamente construido en el recinto de la Casa de Reposo de Kalma del EPC.
					
					Este Teatro es otro regalo de amor que el Dirigente dio a los militares del EPC.
					
					Al recorrer el interior del teatro, se mostro muy satisfecho de que se levanto magnificamente tal teatro moderno dispuesto de todas las instalaciones y evaluo altamente los meritos de los constructores militares.
					
					Los militares del EPC, quienes dedican todo lo suyo a la sagrada batalla por la defensa de la patria, devienen los preciosos camaradas y companeros de armas revolucionarios incambiables con nada, senalo el Dirigente y anadio que para ellos no hay nada de escatimar.
					
					Acto seguido, el vio ahi la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito dedicada a la inauguracion del citado Teatro.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla los generales de ejercito del EPC Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, y otros miembros directivos del ejercito, el secretario del CC del PTC Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento Jang Song Thaek y Choe Ik Gyu y otros cuadros directivos, del CC del PTC.
					
					En la escena se pusieron las piezas, entre ellas, el coro masculino "Se agita el bosque" y "Trotes en el Paektu", el solo y coro masculinos "Mi tierra natal" y "Por la unica patria" y el coro masculino "Camino a la victoria".
					
					A traves del espectaculo, los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patetico el infinito orgullo y dignidad del EPC que enaltece al General Kim Jong Il como Comandante Supremo de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias, y demostraron bien la ferrea conviccion y voluntad de nuestro ejercito dispuesto a llevar a feliz termino con armas la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la grandiosa bandera del Songun (priorizacion militar).
					
					El Dirigente se puso muy contento de que los artistas de la citada banda ofrecieron la magnifica funcion que refleja la confianza y la voluntad de Corea del Songun y el espiritu revolucionario de los militares y elogio altamente los exitos de la funcion. 
					
					Expreso gran esperanza y conviccion de que todos los artistas del Coro Estatal Benemerito seguiran desplegando con vigor tambien en el futuro las actividades artisticas revolucionarias para impulsar activamente al ejercito y al pueblo a la nueva lucha y a la creacion de nuevas proezas y asi manifestaran plenamente el poderio del trompetero de la revolucion del Songun y del destacamento artistico combativo.

articles.title: Continuan mitines congratulatorios de exito de segunda prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Continuan mitines congratulatorios de exito de segunda prueba nuclear
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar los mitines congratulatorios del exito de la segunda prueba nuclear en las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte, de Hamgyong del Sur y del Norte y de Ryanggang.
					  A las ocasiones asistieron los cuadros directivos de los organos del partido, el poder y las organizaciones de masas de esas localidades, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jovenes y estudiantes.
					
					  Los oradores senalaron que la segunda prueba nuclear permitio fortalecer el poderio nacional y la capacidad de defensa nacional de la Corea del Songun (priorizacion militar) al resolver satisfactoriamente los problemas cientifico-tecnicos que pueden desarrollar la tecnologia nuclear de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  Subrayaron que el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, que manifestaron a todo el mundo el impetu de la Corea del Juche que no hace ni la minima concesion en la defensa del maximo interes y la soberania del pais, avanzaran a pasos firmes por la senda de independencia y del Songun llenandose de la fe en la victoria y el optimismo.
					
					  Destacaron que es definitiva la victoria porque el Dirigente Kim Jong Il conduce al frente la Revolucion Coreana.

articles.title: ATCC critica invariable politica hostil a RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC critica invariable politica hostil a RPDC de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- Segun trascendidos, el presidente de Estados Unidos Obama incremento notablemente el egreso para la radioemision exterior de entre el proyecto del presupuesto para el ano fiscal 2010 presentado ante el Congreso y su mayor parte se destina a las emisoras que se dedican exclusivamente a la propaganda anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se dice.
					  Esto demuestra que aunque aparecio nueva administracion en EE.UU., no se cambio en lo minimo la politica hostil de EE.UU. a la RPDC.
					
					  El pais norteamericano inicio a partir de marzo de 1997 por medio de la "Radio para Asia Libre" la emision en lengua coreana y despues aumento constantemente el egreso financiero sobre las radios venales y prolongo el tiempo de radioemision.
					
					  En el ano fiscal para 1998 destino 2 millones de US$ al respecto y egreso hasta 2008 la enorme cantidad de fondos so pretexto de "Ley sobre los DDHH del Norte de Corea".
					
					   El hecho de que la administracion de Obama  destino la enorme suma de fondos a las emisoras con  destino a la RPDC demuestra que la actual politica hostil a Corea es exactamente igual a la de sus anteriores "poderes".
					
					  Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que los gobernantes estadounidenses hablan mucho de que en el proyecto del nuevo presupuesto "esta reflejado el importante papel que la emisora exterior juega para el interes nacional de EE.UU.", lo cual es,  de veras, pueril y sucio acto para enganar al mundo.
					
					  La "Radio para Asia Libre" y la VOA toman por lo principal la difusion de la "libertad" y la "democracia" al estilo norteamericano y el corrupto modo de vida burguesa entre Corea y los demas  paises asiaticos.
					
					  La mayor parte de los contenidos de la emision   esta compuesta de la maledicencia sobre la direccion suprema de los respectivos paises, la censura y la injerencia en los asuntos internos de estos asi como  la propaganda reaccionaria.
					
					  Es indiscutible que tal propaganda de las radios venales tiene por objetivo derrumbar a la RPDC y otros paises que no obedecen docilmente o no agradan al imperio.
					
					  Si EE.UU. se vale de las radios vendidas para difundir la supuesta "libertad" y la "democracia" con el fin de eliminar la idea y el regimen optados por el pueblo coreano, pero, se equivocan mucho.
					
					  Guardamos como confianza nuestra idea en la larga y ardua lucha y apreciamos el mas ventajoso socialismo coreano centrado en las masas populares.
					
					    La tentativa de destruir el sagrado y digno regimen de Corea y esperar algun "cambio" en esta no pasa de ser una absurda ilusion vana de quienes no saben nada de la unidad monolitica entre el lider, el partido y las masas populares.
					
					  Tales maniobras del imperio no pueden ser perdonados jamas.
					
					  Bajo el pretexto del lanzamiento del satelite artificial de la RPDC con fines pacificos, la nueva administracion de EE.UU. hablo tanto de las calumnias de todas formas y llevo a la practica la sancion contra la primera. Ademas, introdujo a los titeres surcoreanos en la "Iniciativa de Seguridad contra la Proliferacion" (PSI en ingles).
					
					  La realidad demuestra fehacientemente que la politica hostil a Corea de EE.UU. no se cambia aunque se sustituye el presidente.
					
					  Como ya hemos declarado, fortaleceremos aun mas la fuerza disuasiva nuclear para defender nuestra idea y regimen.

articles.title: Acto conjunto de amistad por Dia Internacional de Infancia
articles.content:
Acto conjunto de amistad por Dia Internacional de Infancia
Pyongyang, 1 de junio (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 59 aniversario del Primero de Junio, Dia Internacional de la Infancia, tuvo lugar hoy en el Lugar de Recreo Taesongsan el acto de amistad entre los ninos y las mujeres capitalinos y extranjeros
					  A la ocasion asistieron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jung Rin, el ministro de Educacion, Kim Yong Jin, los ex presos de larga condena no abjurados, los funcionarios correspondientes, los ninos y las mujeres de la capital.
					
					  Fueron invitados las mujeres y los ninos de las representaciones diplomaticas de varios paises acreditadas en Corea, los huespedes extranjeros y los coreanos residentes en ultramar, de visita en Corea.
					
					  La presidenta del CC de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, Ro Song Sil, pronuncio discurso de felicitacion.
					
					  Luego, los ninos coreanos y extranjeros, divididos en dos equipos: "erizo" y "tejon", efectuaron diversos juegos de deporte y recreo, entre ellos, el tiro al arco, el quite de pelota, el salto a la comba de flor, la cogida de juguetes y la lucha de la cuerda. 
					
					  En el acto hubo la funcion artistica de los ninos coreanos y extranjeros.
